Love this.
I am the only wine drinker in the house, but can’t always drink a full bottle of wine in 2days. I mean I can! but I don’t always want to drink a bottle in the 2 days that an open bottle stays and keeps its flavor.
This gadget makes the wine last sooo much longer. Easily makes an open bottle of wine last the week and keep its flavor. I am so happy this came into my life and I am not wasting wine anymore!
The price is so inexpensive, but this gadget is so good, especially when considering how much wine it has saved me. Before, I would have to pour out the old wine, now it keeps and I enjoy it later, saving me so much vino! And let’s face it.. that is a priority!
I highly recommend!!

The product works great for what I purchase it for, and that's to help conserve my wine. That being said, I don't much care for the design. There is an aluminum ring on the cap that you can use to set the date you opened the wine, which may be a good idea for some, but it is something I virtually never use. In addition, the ring tends to come off easily. When that happens, I just toss it because I don't use it anyway. The only other thing I've noticed is that the pump fits rather tightly on the cap so when you try to detach it, it sometimes pulls the cap off with it. I'm not sure much can be done about that because you need a tight seal in order to create a vacuum in the wine bottle anyway. I've just learned to hold onto the cap while detaching the pump. Other than those minor things, this is a great product.

They mailed me a card to submit a 5 point review to get a $5 Amazon gift card. The wine strippers are decent and not to bad to use, but the seal is not dependable. Switched back to regular stoppers after a few weeks. I would have likely given more than 1 star, but I hate companies that try to buy reviews.

Honestly, i can't think of anything to take any stars off for, good value for the money, the stoppers all seem to hold the air out well, and it's easy to use. It's held up well for about 6 bottles of wine, over the course of 2-3 months, so not a ton of use. I see it holding up well for the value I paid. Also I like the fitted foam it came in, i'd like to make a wood box for it to keep it in, saving the foam for that purpose! If the vendor made a more expensive version in a decent wood box for storage, i'd buy it! For comparison, I've had one or two others from other brands, this one seems as good or a bit better than those others I have used in the past.

It does what it is supposed to do. It's well built and stylish. I must confess that I don't keep a bottle of wine open for very long, two or three days usually, but I can taste the effect of oxygen on the wine after a day. This tool helps retain the taste that the wine had on the day that I first opened the bottle. Being the lazy guy that I am, I wish that they made one with an electric pump. I mean, who wants to stand there, half stewed, pumping away on a half-empty bottle of wine? Just kidding.

This wine vacuum pump with stoppers was super easy to use, especially for a beginner! If needed, instructions are clearly listed both on the box and in a little pamphlet inside the box. It only took a couple pumps and the bottle was completely sealed which kept the wine fresh for about a week as described. The pump and stoppers are easy to store. The price is fair for such a nifty tool, I would definitely order again as gifts.

This type of wine saver works well so long as the bottle is at least half full and you drink the remainder in a day or two. There are limits to how much air you can actually pump out so the more wine left in the bottle the more effective it will be. When I do lave less than a half bottle of red I pump it and then store it in the fridge. Hopefully i then remember to set it out an hour or two before drinking.

Seriously, I tried houdini, rabbit, etc and even the spray gas that's supposed to keep your wine tasting good. I wasn't really happy with any of them.
Products that used to be designed well and work great, all of a sudden did not work the same anymore (even when stoppers were replaced).
In desperation I bought this pump and the reviews did not lie. It is amazing.
It feels so tight that unlike the others, I wouldn't feel worried putting the wine bottle on its side (but I don't typically do that).
I use it all the time!

This is my first experience with a wine vaccum. I like that it keeps the wine fresh longer and that works for me. The date dial on the vaccuum plug is overkill and unnecessary in my opinion. The process of actually using it in the beginning could be challenging. Its just repetition, the more you use it the easier it becomes to use.

This is one of the best wines savers that I've had so far. It has a dial on top to point to the day that you opened the bottle. And the top has a little release valve on it to relieve the suction. It also keeps the suction the entire time without escaping. This is a great wine saver.

This doesn't work as you would think it does.
You would think that you'd put the plug in the wine bottle and then simply put the pump on top and pump the air out. There's some problems with that
1. there isn't a seal between the pump and the plug. You have to hold the pump on top of the plug
2. The pump does not release the air on the return stroke so it never really makes a vacuume
In the end I did one stroke of the pump to get the air out the air out then move the pump off and on the plug and suck the air out again with the pump. I finally gave up and returned it

This is easy to use and works perfectly. It takes longer to read the instructions (or this review!) than to use it. It keeps the wine fresh with minimal cost and effort. I'm the only wine-drinker in our household so this is important to me; stale wine can be awful. I like having four of the stoppers, although currently it's more than I will ever have open at once. A high-quality product at a low price.
such a simple tool but if the soft rubber gasket falls out of the pump, it will no longer remove air from the bottle

I was looking for a wine vacuum that could be easily stored (in a cabinet, not on the counter), along with several bottle stoppers. My last wine vacuum was electric and stopped working after about 50 uses. I came across this set, and I love it! It's so easy to use. You place the stoppers on the bottle and pump 15-20 times until resistance is felt while pumping. When reopening the bottle, release the air with the tab at the top of the stopper and open the bottle. The wine stays fresh, and I also love that I received more than a couple of stoppers. Highly recommend.
I’ve just received this item today. Disappointed is understatement! Pump casing came apart! Though I can fix it by adding glue, but I’m going to send back and ask my money back.

Love this thing! Super easy to use, love hearing that pfssst sound a day or two later when I pull off the top to pour another glass of wine. Keeps wine fresh tasting for up to 4 days. rev_title.name: If you like wine, you need these.

rev_det.name: These are fakes. They do not resemble the actual Vacu Vin stoppers. These are black in color smell like rubber and are not constructed the same as the official ones.

I ordered these after the two I bought years ago at my wine and cheese store started showing signs of losing suction. Only one in this pack works! I even ordered the same brand I have now. You are supposed to put the stopper in the bottle and pump the air out with a special device that I originally bought. You pump until you hear it making clicking sounds. That tells you the air has been pumped out. Only 1 properly pumped and clicked. I about wore my arm out trying to pump the others. My husband tried as well and got the same result. When comparing the one that worked with the others, you can see they are not made the same. The one that works has a round bottom and the other is deformed and won’t seal properly (in photo, the left one is deformed). Even the slightest difference is shape will not allow a proper seal. Luckily one of my originals is still working and I’ll keep the one from this pack that functions properly. Had to throw the others out. Disappointing when the quality control is so bad. I’d recommend buying this product at a reputable wine store.

These vacu vin wine saver stoppers do NOT work with then older vacu vin pumps. At first the older pump seemed to create the vacuum with these stoppers, but when I went to open the bottle again, the vacuum had leaked air into the bottle. I had thought that by purchasing the same brand of stopper as the pump that I had they would work together. So if you have an older pump do NOT buy these stoppers.

If you're a wine lover, chances are you may have a few bottles of wine uncorked at any given time. That was the case here--I had one bottle of dry red wine open for cooking, another dessert wine chilling in the fridge...and a third bottle I had just opened. The Vacu Vin only came with two stoppers, so buying this six pack was a necessity. The product does work well to evacuate the oxygen from an open bottle--if you are reading this prior to deciding on a Vacu Vin, I can safely recommend purchasing it, and buying these along with it. The 6-pack is a far better deal than the smaller packages. And knowing how things tend to "disappear" in our kitchen, having a few spares is always helpful!

This brand may be a best seller but when you type in "wine stoppers" how many other brands and styles to you see? Only one on the first page so here's the scoop in short and brief summary.
Buy a brand such as Le Creuset which have several rows of thin flanges. This style makes a longer lasting seal and much more effective seal but. this Vacu Vin design has one advantage because it is a conical tapered shape (smooth sides) and if you need to use it on a bottle which has a larger than standard hole it will fit better than the straight sided design with the flanges. But it has no flanges. it depends on you pushing it very firmly into the bottle as you pump out the air. But when you release the air you will always hear a much, much larger sucking sound when releasing the multiple-flange style compared to the VV design. I have "corked" more than 200 times with the Vacu Vin. I have "corked" more than 2000 times using two other brands with much superior design and these VacuVin stoppers which are always the loser by a very noticeable difference.
I'm asking Amzn to accept a return. When you're trying to save a $60.00 bottle of wine you want what works and after more than 200 uses, i am certain that the Vacu Vin shape and design is inferior to the designs with multiple thin flanges. it's not rocket science. three rows of thin flanges create many times more holding power than a smooth skin of the Vacu Vin design being pressed to the slick glass.

Been drinking wine for 60 years and bought the Vacu-Vin system when it was first introduced in the 80's. Before then I was using corks and had 'spoiled wine' in a matter of days. With Vacu-Vin, I was able to go a week with younger wines about 2-3 days on older vintages. I still use Vacu-Vin products as it has been solid and reputable. I've tried others and they didn't work as well - perhaps its the many ribs you see that help the vacuum seal last longer. I've tried the nitrogen gas and all that fancy stuff, but those were just too much trouble and cost far more.
The best part for me are two reasons I use it:
(1) Rather than trying to find half-bottles I can easily save the remaining wine for 3 days (or more) and spend less on the wine (Half bottles are more expensive and less choice).
(2) I don't feel bad or concerned about opening a special bottle like the one on the left in the picture because I can enjoy it over 2-3 days.
It's easy to use. You'll start replacing corks after 25 years just to get a better seal. That relatively inexpensive compared to all the wine that will spoil if you don't use a vacu vin. regards..m

I’ve used four different vacuum wine stoppers over the past few years.
One brand is similar to Vacu Vin in that it has an external pump. These wouldn’t develop as much suction as Vacu Vin and would only maintain the vacuum for a day or two. After 3 or 4 years 3 one of the stoppers failed completely (would not seal at all) and the other would maintain the vacuum for about 30 minutes.
The two other brands had built-in pumps. I did prefer the convenience of built-in pumps but there was less suction, they only maintained the vacuum for more a couple of days, and they failed completely after about two years.
Meanwhile, my original Vacu Vin - which I’ve had for about 10 years - still maintains a vacuum for a couple of days. And the new Vacu Vin stoppers I just got (actual Vacu Vin, not knock-offs) maintained a strong vacuum seal on a newly open bottle of red wine for 12 days.

I received the stoppers and noted a couple of things. First, I had a couple of these already, which look like the product pictured - grey with 4 vent holes. These new ones don't look as pictured - are black instead of grey, and only have 3 vent holes vs. 4, which increases the time it takes to pump air from a wine bottle. Finally, the center vacuum relief nub has some rubber stems from the molding process still attached - the ones I already had lacked these and were well-finished.
In summary, they're usable, but they don't quite feel right, as though they're a knockoff vs. a genuine Vacu Vin product. Then too, it could also simply be that Vacu Vin has changed the design and is going cheaper in it's production standards.
-----------
Update - a few weeks later, two have stopped holding a vacuum. Very frustratins. I ran over to Bed Bath & Beyond and - low and behold - they have the real Vacu Vin stoppers that look like the ones pictured in this seller's ad. With that, I have to say this seller is misrepresenting what they're selling, and these are not the genuine article. I'd advise anyone to stay away from this one.

The items I received are not the ones shown in the picture and feel like an inferior quality ... I believe they are a knockoff of the ones by Vacu Vin Inc. The items that were shipped are black in color and in the pictures they are compared to the stoppers by Vacu Vin Inc. They do however seem hold a seal in a bottle. Time will tell if they last as long as the "actual" ones that I had previously purchased.

I was down to two Vacu Vin stoppers so I ordered another four. When I die I expect to meet up with the odd socks that mysteriously disappear in the dryer and my missing Vacu Vin stoppers.
I have kept a bottle of red wine perfect for well over a month with the Vacu Vin system. These do precisely what they are intended to do.

Best wine (not champagne) stoppers I’ve ever bought.
NOT for carbonated drinks unless the bottle has small opening.
Useful ONLY on bottles with 3/4-inch opening

rev_det.name:
A good way to test a bottle stopper like this is to remove the foil or labeling from around the neck of an empty bottle, preferably a clear one. Insert the stopper, and then look at the seal or area of contact between the stopper and the bottle, all the way around.
Results for the Joie brand were pretty impressive: Nearly 1/4 of an inch, all around! For comparison, I tried the same test with some generic stoppers purchased at a liquor store years ago, and they were barely able to form a consistent seal, less than 1/16" at its widest. (In the past, I've used Zyliss stoppers; unfortunately, I don't have any of those around to compare.)
My first time using this stopper, I noticed it kept popping out slightly, seating itself at an angle. I was initially concerned by this, but it turns out to have been caused by my closing the stopper one-handed. The seal itself was just fine. A two-handed approach seems to work best: Hold the bottle with one hand, seating the stopper firmly in place with your thumb, while pushing down the lever with your other hand.

At first, I felt this item is pretty good until I found out that it leaks. Every time I open the refrigerator, I hear noise "Shoooo". I never hard that noise in a Ref. So I checked where, then found out my Champaign was leaking. I think this isn't for bubbly beverage. I have another company's and it really close tightly. This one's end is too small to stop escaping it. So regular beverage might be ok, still flavor will lose in time. I think they should make larger end to solve this problem.

The diameter of these stoppers is too small to seal a wine bottle or a bottle of tonic water. When I clicked to return these, I got a message that this item is NOT ELIGIBLE FOR RETURN! I just wasted my money on this product. Save yours, don't buy it!

I’ve now purchased these three times over five plus years (occasionally I lose them, camping or when bringing bottles to friends’ houses).
They are NOT for champagne, or anything else equally bubbly/pressurized, but for wine and juice and very lightly carbonated items, they’re fantastic. I’ve never had one break, or leak, even when a bottle has fallen over in a cooler.
I just wish they came in more colors and/or I could choose colors. The last order I got was all red, while we drink more white and have a lot of lime green accessories in our kitchen, so the aesthetic side of me wishes I could choose all green :)

it does a good job keeping a beer carbed, but just for mayble 24 hours. Not longer. It doesn' fit real tight in my beer bottles and the inside of the necks are slanted. Probably seal better if straight necked. I like it as I usually finish the beer later in the day or the next. I have gotten a little pop sound with unsealing so is doing some good.

Bought these to keep Champagne fresh but they are too small to keep a tight seal. When you clamp the stopper down you can just pull it right out without that much effort. So that means that it will work for a couple hours but once the pressure builds back up in the bottle it will leak out. Fine for wine maybe. Ive tried them in multiple brands bottles, with beer, and they are just too small. I've used other ones that my grandma had that worked great but I'm not sure of the brand. If anyone has a better suggestion let me know!

I don't drink, but I do have an overwhelming Pellegrino addiction, and the glass bottles are not re-sealable. This does a fantastic job of keeping the bottle completely sealed, and I don't lose any carbonation or get a "stale" taste when I use the bottle again a day or two later. The devices themselves are simple and sturdy, and I've had no difficulty with them. Clean-up is easy since I'm only using them with water. I'm not sure how difficult it would be to clean the rubber if they were used with wine stored horizontally.
The only "trick" to using them that I have found is that it helps to hold the stopper flush against the bottle with one hand while pushing the lever down with the other. This keeps the stopper from springing up when the stopper expands.

I use this for my wine bottles, and it works perfectly! It doesn't leak if you set it on its side. That's how I've always set it in the fridge, and I've never had a single leak or drop. It keeps the wine so fresh that the stopper nearly flies out of the bottle when you release the handle because it traps so much air into the bottle. It leaves it fresh for about 4 days.

I was looking for some airtight stoppers for the occasional standard wine bottle, but also for assorted other bottles of drinks and condiments. The product description here says:
* VERSATILE – Use it to seal mineral water, wine, beer, champagne, vinegar, oil, and more.
That claim is decpetive. For bottles with openings very close in size to 3/4 inches (many, not all, non-sparkling wines) it provides a good seal. Tried it on some vinegar, oil, coffee syrup, sparlking wine, soft drink, and other bottles, and the stopped either fell out or leaked some gas. Even if the inner diameter was 13/16", there were problems.

Reviews of all products available in this category are distressingly poor. I ordered these out of desperation and hoped to get lucky. When you first examine them you may be disappointed. They feel very flimsy. The first time I used one in a bottle of bubbly I was certain the thing would snap apart before gaining a seal. Boy - was I wrong! These things are stronger than they look and they turned out to be every bit as good as my former ones that were made mostly of metal. Recommended

I love these little wine stoppers. The suction works very well and I can lie my wine bottles on their sides in the fridge and there is no leakage. Would definitely recommend!
(could probably be used for other bottles as well- beer, cider, etc.)

I've tried a few other stoppers but the Joe Joie is by far the most effective and easy to use. I recently bought stoppers at a supermarket and they both broke within a few uses. These are very sturdy and are adaptable to a nice variety of bottles. I do recommend using a vacuum stopper for wines and use these for CO2 beverages but keeping air out and no leaks is the most important thing and these stoppers do that.

I first received some of these as a gift from my father-in-law 2 years ago. They seal the bottle up nicely. The bottle can even lay on its side and won't leak. When one of them broke (the hubby repaired), I had to order more to make sure that I always had some handy. I've never had an issue with them fitting any of my wine bottles.

Worked fine on Champagne bottles but was too small for Corona beer 32 oz bottles. They are not adjustable. Bought 3 more on a second order and they would not work with any of bottles because the were top large to fit the bottles.

We had some similar to these for a few years, but they all eventually broke. These are much sturdier than the others we had, and I expect them to last for many years. The flip down expanding design allows you to lay the bottles down in the fridge (white wine) or stand them up in the door. Many of the cone shaped ones are too tall for the door, and will leak if you lay them down. Before I used this product, I filled an empty wine bottle with water, put the stopper in, flipped it over and put it in the sink overnight. Not a drop escaped. We liked them so much that we ordered two more sets, one for my mother and one for friends.

How did my wine survive without this? I don’t normally drink a full bottle of wine at a time and struggled with storage of an open bottle. This stopper is amazing! No more leaky corks or leaky stoppers because the stopper allows you to lay the bottle on the side and it doesn’t leak at all. Easy to use easy to wash just all-around a great product.

The only way I can get these to seal a bottle of Miller Lite is to place it in the opening then when the lever is down expanding the plug I carefully pull the stopper up till it almost comes out of the bottle. That's the only way to get a tight fit. If I were to insert the stopper all the way in then lower the lever the fit is very loose. It must be pulled up into the upper narrower part of the bottle neck.

I got these for my Mom as part of a retirement gift basket after her previous stoppers were wearing out and she LOVES them. Said it keeps her wine much fresher and the way it inserts and expands in the neck to block the air keeps champagne bubbles longer too. And since they come in a multi-pack she gave me one to keep at my house "for when she visits" ;)

This works very well, there's not much to it it's a bottle stopper. But it does keep the carbonation from dissipating. I'm not using it for wine but I'm assuming if it can hold in the carbonation in Seltzer it can keep out oxygen or whatever degrades wine. So far it's held up very well even in multiple washings and mechanically it seems sturdy enough

Mom loves it and I love it for the price/quantity.
Glad I got this. Very simple to use. Very easy to remove. I just wished I got these sooner. Sticking a used cork and chipping the cork back down into a wine bottle can be quite frustrating, especially when you just want to preserve the wine much longer.
Smart purchase and definitely a cool life hack I had wished I had known sooner. My moms happy, so I'm happy.
I'll get more if they break , but they seem to last pretty good. The ones that aren't being used currently sit in a drawer until the time is right to use them.

I've used these a few times now and they do the job. They seem pretty durable. **Note: apparently these are not returnable.** I found this out the hard way when I accidentally ordered two sets and could not return the extra. Now I have more than I need but Amazon's excellent customer service resolved it by refunding the second set. Overall, perfectly happy with the purchase.

If you don't finish a bottle of champagne right away, the challenge is to keep it til next day - course, the original cork won't go back in, so...? This thing works great! It is tight enough to withstand the pressure from a half full bottle and it was still good enough for mimosas for breakfast. Can't beat the efficacy given the price.

Works good for saving a half bottle of beer.
Yeah, I know, why not just finish the bottle?
Because sometimes, I just don't want that much.
I buy good, expensive craft beer.
Sometimes it comes in large bottles.
I don't want to just chug it down, but I'm certainly not going to dump it out. I want to be able to save a half bottle for later or the next day.
This is the solution.

I'm very disappointed that these stoppers do not expand enough to fill at least two different European bottlenecks - one Greek and one French. I thought wine bottlenecks were a standard size. Perhaps these stoppers will work with US domestic wines. Easy to use but they easily pull out after setting.

I've only had these for a few days, but so far they are working fine, as in my wine bottles on their side don't leak. For me, to get the fifth star they should be somewhat shorter in over all height and not go so far into the bottle. They wobble a bit when used, but don't leak. They are doing their job perfectly, but could be tweaked a bit. No idea about how long they will continue to be leak free.

Easy way to seal a wine bottle, that will be used shortly. I even have it lying on its side in the wine cooler and have no leaking. I use a vacuum sealer for some bottles, but this works fine for most. Also good for something with a bit of a fizz, but I don't put those on their side.

I love these little things. We like Champagne a lot in my household and these work perfectly for keeping it sealed and keeping the bubbles going. I have yet to have a flat bottle after using one of these neat little trinkets. I will definitely purchase these again if I need to.

I can't say enough about this product. I tried several other bottle stoppers for carbonated beverages and none of them worked. Either they didn't make an air-tight seal or they would pop off the bottle due to the pressure. This product works perfectly for both soda and champagne. I have never had one fail.

After reading the product description and reviews, I purchased two packs of these stoppers to use for carbonated beverages on April 18, 2018. They do not work!!!! As soon as I cap off the carbonated beverage, the stopper got pushed to the top of bottle and I thought it was going to pop off. This is dangerous and given it wouldn't stay in the completely down position in the bottle...I just wasted $16.

I was excited to get these, but a little disappointed as well. They don't seem to seat well so the seal is not always made. In fact they look a little lopsided after inserting them in the wine bottle. One of them wouldn't even expand so therefore is probably useless.

These Really Work and Make Great Gifts
HOW HAVE I MANAGED TO LIVE WITHOUT THIS

rev_det.name:
These are fun and the perfect gift for any sassy friend in your life! The quotes are hilarious!! Not only that, but they are well made! I have been using an old santa wine stopper, with a broken hat, for at least a year. Once in awhile (when the wine actually remains in the fridge and doesn't get drank ;) my wine gets tipped over and santa falls out. These cute wine stoppers fix that problem, check out my pictures. You can completely turn over your wine bottle and these babies aren't going anywhere. Plus, they are less bacteria friendly. They are really easy to wash, unlike stoppers (like santa) that have the cork stop. I love these sassy wine stoppers and will keep them in mind for all of my girlfriend's birthdays :) (because this set is mine!!)
Disclaimer: I did receive this product at a discount in exchange for an honest and unbiased review, which I have provided. Unlike some reviewers, I do not give every product a 5 star rating automatically. If a product is a piece of junk, I rate it as such. If a product, like this one, exceed my expectations, I rate it 5 stars.

I hate corks, real and fake, so these are a fantastic solution to not being able to get a cork back in or out. They go on and come off easy and I while I haven't tried storing my wines on their side (I have no need to) they have a little lip on the inside that the lip of the bottle fits into and seems like it is a god snug fit. I don't really care for the phrases on them, but these were the cheapest option and I can live with it.

After using these, I will throw away all of my internal stoppers. These fasten around the sides of the bottle at the top. They have really worked for me and can keep wine remnants for several days. Of course, you could argue that you should just finish up that remnant immediately, but if you are watching your calories with wine at dinner, then these will hold over the rest of the bottle very well. Also--They Make Great Gifts.

These works very well. They snugly fit the bottle top but not so tight that it is difficult to get on. They are the anti wine stopper that can take the pretentious wine snob down a peg or two. And let's not forget the soda bottle or the bottle of oil that is topless because your cat chased the top under the refrigerator. Surely there is something in the bathroom that needs a cap too.

Love them - they work great, and i don't have a big piece/lever on top (like some air tight models) making it difficult to put on top shelf in fridge. I don't know how well they would keep the fizz of a champagne bottle yet, ...i rarely have left overs ;) - but it does fit on top of one.
Seems to do a great job keeping the wine in and not spilling out. Very easy to wash, and use,.. I gave a few sets of these away as Christmas gifts. The loved it!,, Nice sayings..
I got few of these to give out during the holiday. Everyone got a good laugh out of it. Highly recommended.
Way better than corks!
Nice
bought these from my wine loving friends and family.

rev_det.name: The item is well made, it's feels solid. The letter on top is large, the rubber fits the wine bottle well and the platform under the letter makes it easy to pull out. I like it!

This is a super cute gift to give to a new bride who is about to change her last name. It’s a sweet reminder that her initial is going to match the one she loves. It’s true to the picture, loved the style and was told the wine stopper, works great!
I bought this as a gift for my mother who loves wine. Is it pretty sturdy and durable but feels like plastic still. I was impressed for the price.
Lovely item. My niece loves wine and her initial is L. I thought it would be a nice gift. The item shipped arrived in a pleasant packaging. Requested a second one for her husband.
Great quality for the price. Looks classy, good finishing and makes for a great gifting item.

Got this for my boyfriend as part of a Valentine’s Day gift and he loved it! The quality was amazing and honestly better than I imagined it’d be. Absolutely love it and would buy again as a gift for others
Beautiful!!
I bought a couple of these for gifts for coworkers. They are good quality and look nice.
My sister loved this I got this for her for Christmas she loved it so much thanks so much
Super cute & good quality, bought a bunch for friends and family as stocking stuffers this year
Very nice, the hammered gold is beautiful. Well made!
Super cute!
Recipient of gift liked it!
Wife loved it
It looks fantastic. Love it.
This was a gift and she loved it.

rev_det.name: I’m a wine rep and this has saved me so many times. Corks will pop if you shove them in after opening. Cheap versions of sealers will last about 15 minutes. I’m traveling and neeeed this! An explosion of that bubbly will go places inside your car that never sees the light of day. As much as you clean, you will have spots and sticky surfaces for-ev-er UNLESS you have this sealer. So imagine the inside of your refrigerator.

As the only wine drinker in my family, I seldom have champagne at home because no cork can keep the bubbles, until this one. It was made by another company (Metrolane) and I got a couple about 2 years ago, but can't remember the place. I can keep a champagne bottle bubbly for a week with this cork!. Looking for a replacement, I could not find them at a liquor store or home store. Finally googled and found them at Amazon!! It looks as though Rabbit bought out Metrolane, though their name is still on the corks. I ordered several for gifts. An example where Amazon excels, in finding odd things immediately instead of driving to multiple stores around town!

they work very well to preserve champange but DO NOT lay the bottles down with these in them they will either shoot out in the fridge or shot off like a cannon when you go to re open ... keep them right side up when in place

I have bought several Rabbit products including this product and believed in their products. Unfortunately my original champagne resealable cap I purchased in the store no longer worked so I ordered a new one from Amazon .... twice. The first one I received was clearly a returned item and didn't work. I requested a return and Amazon replaced the item only to receive another one that, again, looked like it had been used, was defective and returned and again, didn't work. I give up. I will go back to the beverage box house and buy a resealable champagne cap but I don't think I will buy this style again even though the original one I had worked for a long time.

This stopper is the best I've ever used! It seals the bottle up perfectly. I had a bottle of champagne in the refrigerator for almost a month and when I opened it back up, it was like I was opening a brand new bottle! I like to drink a mimosa now and then, but when it's only me, I don't drink the whole bottle. I've wasted too many bottles this way. Now with this stopper, I don't have to worry about always picking up a new bottle. Love it!

When it works, it’s very effective. However, at some point (that comes much too quickly), they stop working. The stopper won’t respond to the dial and that’s it. It no longer works. I won’t use them any longer and am looking for an alternative.

I've bought a few of these over the years. Gifted them to Family & Friends as well. They are awesome, WHILE THEY WORK !!! The Fizz in the champagne actually stays for 3-4 days ( sometimes more ) No problem in laying the bottle on its side verses standing it up.
BUT !!! they do spoil pretty fast if you twist it too much. You have to get the feel of it to see how far is just right. I dont now, have a problem with that, but I do have a problem with the whole topper getting very sticky. At first i thought it was just me, but My Son & Brother in PA, Sister in London England, Friend in Paris, France, Our vacation home in FL, Daughter & Her friend in NC, ALL have had the same problem. Soooo it has nothing to do with the atmosphere.
Having said that, these are way better than the others I've bought & experimented with. Thus I keep buying. I'm making my self feel better by thinking of them as expensive disposable toppers. But at least they last 2-4 years before they go bad.
Buying 4 more after I finish with this review.
Are they worth buying?? Yes.
Are they worth giving as a gift ? Yes.
More than it spoiling, I dont like it getting sticky. Maybe I need to keep it in its original case verses a drawer. Will try & up date review when the time comes.

So it worked great for about 5 times, then just stopped. No, I did not over tighten it. It was actually sealed properly, I unscrewed it, poured a glass and went to put it back on but it would no longer tighten/seal. It just spins. POS.
And I bought 2 of these too. Using the 2nd one right now but I'm sure that one is going to fail shortly too.

This little gem did what it was intended to do. Until I reached into the drawer the other day, and it stuck to my hand. You can see the “substance” on the body—it’s nasty. This did not come from contact with some item in the drawer. No way. I washed it several times I’m hot water and soap. Then I washed it again and scrubbed it. No luck. The stuff just comes back, sticky and icky as ever. So my theory is something is rotten on Denmark and it spread to this stopper.

I looked high and low to get a couple more of these. Bought some from QVC years ago and wanted a couple more. For the 2 liter soda bottle - these go on tight and seriously keep the fizz in your carbonated drinks. I LOVE them. If you want to save your carbonated beverages from going flat - these are the ticket.

I bought one of these through one of my business management classes at SSU while we were discussing the wine industry in 2003 . It works great with champagne and wine bottles, and for the purpose of this review, I just tried it with a 2 liter soda bottle. I wouldn't bother with a soda bottle since they have a reusable cap already, but if you lost it or found the sealer easier to handle, you could.
I'm just now repurchasing in 2016 because the outside plastic has gotten gummy and sticky (not from not washing it). I don't know if it's a coating they use that degraded or what, but while it doesn't affect the function of it on the inside, it feels funny and looks like it's dirty (but won't wash off). I like it so much, I hunted it up to buy new again, and will continue to do so as long as they make it (or someone invents something better!). Great little device!

Very happy with this so far. I like to drink bubbly from time to time, but I hate to let a bottle go to waste if it can't all be drunk in one sitting. I am able to save it for a few days after opening with this stopper!
I've used Rabbit products before, and the first time I used one of these it took me a few tries to figure out how it worked. I watched a video on YouTube to help too. Now I've got it down.
If anything changes I will update this review, but so far so good.

Instructions are limited to this: put sealer into the bottle top. The product requires delicate handling. Chinese made. The product, if working, meets expectations. BUT Product requires careful use.- Turing sealer too far breaks the mechanism. It’s easy to break unintentionally n permanently, because not clear when to stop turning the mechanism when opening or closing. Must turn the top slowly clockwise to seal n reverse to open. Will not fit all champagne bottle’s necks. I’ve already on three of them n will not buy again.
Worked once. Doesn’t expand anymore. Second Rabbit champagne stopper that we’ve owned that has failed. Don’t waste your money. Buy a rubber stopper.

We have probably used this twice and it already isn't working. The reviews are relatively positive but when you look at the question and answers, you see that lots of people have this problem. Apparently it breaks very very easily! Just know when you get this that it's basically disposable.

I bought three stoppers through Amazon, as the Rabbit Stopper I purchased locally was excellent at keeping Prosecco bubbly for up to a week. Sadly, none of the three came even close to my store bought Rabbit. They had a very poor seal, so bottles of Prosecco went flat in less than 24 hours. I see that the ones from Amazon have a shorter plug in the center than my original. I wonder if it was made in the same place as my original. Also there are depressions in all three amazon stoppers.... which are not seen in my original one. I will not gift them. I ended up buying another brand that’s three times as expensive, but works well.

I ordered this for personal use. After securing the top in place, I placed it in the refrigerator. After about 30 minutes, I heard a loud **POP** sound. When I opened the refrigerator, I found that the bottle had exploded, the top flew off, and the entire bottle of champagne covered everything in the fridge. Do not purchase.

This champagne keeper works very well for our usage. It certainly keeps a bottle fresh at least for a few hours, or even over night. I don't think we have tried using it to keep a bottle much longer than a day, maybe two at the most, but it always works to keep the champagne fresh and sparkling. The mechanism is very easy to use, just make sure it is loosened and then insert and tighten to the right until it is good and snug. We have had ours for over a year now and it still works perfectly. We have tried a few other types and this works this best by far.
In the interest of full disclosure, our champagne habits are pretty narrow. We typically drink Korbel or Moet and just go through a few bottles for mimosas on a Sunday for brunch, or for a special occasion. I suspect we use this device no more than a couple of times a month on average, except for maybe around the holidays so YMMV.

I got this thinking it would work as well as the one I had previously that was a different brand. Turns out this one is made of cheap plastic, is hard to turn, and doesn't seal well.very difficult to use. I recommend getting a different brand. You get what you pay for with this...

I didn't even know such a product existed until some friends told me about it recently. So in anticipation of Christmas Eve Prosecco, I ordered this and thought I'd give it a go. It definitely kept the Prosecco bubbly until we were able to finish the bottle the next day! And it was super-easy to use. My step-mother was so impressed, she asked me to get her one for her birthday!

A must have to anyone that loves wine, and hates wasting it! This product allows you to open a good bottle of wine on Monday, but not feel guilty for only having a glass of it! Use this product and your great bottle of wine will taste just as good on Friday when you get back to it! Have a glass of wine at home guilt free or with over consumption (just not to waste it) with this product!!!! Works as it says it should. I would order two or three, you know...just in case!!!

I previously had a pump cork system..... and it just was flat out horrible. I couldn't hardly put any pressure on the cork without it unsealing. this one however, I literally could hold my bottle of wine by this airtight cork and swing the bottle around my living room on the white carpet and not have any worries that my white carpet will be stained red. I originally purchased because I realized how not air tight my old cork was when I went to lay a bottle of rather expensive champagne down in my fridge and it poured out everywhere. I immediately ordered this. After receiving I put it on said champagne. I somehow forgot I had this delicious beverage in my fridge for 2-3 weeks, opened it up and IT WAS STILL FIZZY. it tasted and fizzed like it had just been opened for the first time. I absolutely love this thing. Definitely will be buying more.

I bought this so my wife could have her glass of sparkling wine everyday and to help keep the bottle fresh for the three or four days it takes her to finish the bottle. It did its job, you place it inside the bottle and turn it to tighten up the stopper in to the neck of the bottle. On the fourth bottle it stopped tightening up! it just turns and turns and turns but never getting tighter.

Was amazed by how well this stored champagne the first few uses! Unfortunately only was able to use it on about 10 bottles of champagne until it stopped working. It now just turns forever without tightening. Not worth your money - garbage!

So I bought this on September 29, 2020. And today it is now broken. This is ansolute garbage. So be warned, the lifetime if this product is apparently 2 months. And I tried to report this as damaged/defective but apparently there is "no customer support" for this product, which suggests to me that they know it's crap and will stop working 2 months after purchase.

This does not work on all bottles and will pop off if the bottle isn't large enough. You wouldn't think they vary that much, but apparently they do. I expected more from the name brand product but I have a generic one that is similar and I like much better.

This product doesnt work as adveritzed. It says screw it until its tight. I screw and screw and screw and it never gets tight. My hands hurt from screwing so much. I threw away 8 bucks for each of the two I bought. Its a terrible product that simply does not work. Amazon should not advertize this product for sale. I’d return it but I dont have the packaging or time to deal with it. Amazon should test these products before letting these scammers sell this crap.

"Velvet Wine/Champagne Sealer by Metrokane" AND "Metrokane Velvet Champagne and Wine Sealer" (I bought both). THEY ARE THE SAME, they even come wrapped the same. The only difference is the company selling "Velvet Wine\Champagne Sealer charged so much more. The picture does not show it packaged and the wording for the product is different. I thought perhaps that the one more expensive was better quality. I FEEL MISLED!
The actual product does work great and it is very useful for all carbonated and non carbonated drinks in a bottle.

This thing is fantastic. I forgot I had a bottle of prosecco in my fridge and when I pulled it out today and reopened it the carbonation was just like when I first opened the bottle. I opened the bottle about a month and a half ago. I didn't drink the remaining bubbly because it didn't taste quite right but man I was surprised at how much carbonation was still there.

Did not work and by the time I wanted to use it the window for return expired. DO NOT BUY this item. I ordered two and neither worked. They did NOT tighten on my champagne bottle. Very disappointed because I had one from way back that still works perfectly.

Like others said mine worked well in the beginning then failed after 2 months. The end of the internal retractable part no longer retracts when the top is screwed. Good concept but ultimately it’s fragile and not durable. I’ll be going back to the stopper that I used to use which is foolproof.

This relies on a few pieces of cheap plastic. There is a screw mechanism that is supposed to expand the rubber stopper as the screw tightens, blocking the bottle. The problem is it doesn't work and you can screw all you like, it just spins and spins and doesnt expand. Crappy design and worse execution. stick with the classic.

These bottle sealers work great! I own at least 3 or 4 of them now, and won't ever go back to using standard bottle stoppers. They are very easy to use -- the top of these sealers twists, which removes excess air from the bottle and keeps wine/champagne fresh. I've actually used one on a champagne bottle and when I opened the bottle 6 days later, there was still plenty of fizz/bubbles remaining. I highly recommend these bottle sealers!

My wife and I are champagne drinkers and have had a hard time finding stoppers that keep champagne from going flat. We have used a variety of different silicon stoppers in the past, but they don't always fit well and will often pop out in the refrigerator from the gas pressure in the champagne. This stopper has worked perfectly so far. It screws into the bottle and seems to expand as it goes in, so it can fit different bottle sizes. We haven't had it pop out a single time, and the champagne stays carbonated for days. It adds very little additional height to the bottle so the bottle can still be stood upright in the fridge.

What a handy kitchen tool! Previously I've used the plug-style stoppers for wine and champagne--they work alright for wine, but the carbonation of champagne causes the plugs to pop out, ruining the champagne.
This sealer cranks down on the bottle such that it doesn't release under the carbonation pressure from the champagne. I've had no problems with it. Taking the advice of other reviewers, I do not overdo it when tightening it onto a bottle. Apparently it's possible to break the sealer by overdoing it, but I haven't run into this. Also, it has fit the vast majority of the bottle types I've tried so far.
Had for a little over two months and the top snapped with normal use.

I've kept bottles of champagne for up to a week in the fridge... so I can have a glass a day. It really keeps the fizz. You get some oxidation, but for a pretty cheap tool that requires no nitrogen it works great. Just insert into the bottle neck and twist until it's tight. To remove, untwist and hear that comforting hiss that tells you it still has plenty of bubbles. No fancy equipment, no bubble destroying vacuum pumps, no hard to attach snap tops. I've bought them for friends who also love them.
If you're looking for an easy solution to keep a partial bottle of champagne for a few days, this one is highly recommended.

The Metrokane Sealer is a real pressure seal that is simple to put on any glass bottle containing a carbonated beverage. It is much easier than pounding a cork back into the throat of bottle, and a much better seal. Its attractive to boot.
After you have drunk some portion of a carbonated beverage, the Metrokane Sealer will seal off the remaining beverage from the atmosphere and hold that seal even as pressure rebuilds inside the bottle. Pressure will always rebuild because carbon dioxide outgasses from the liquid into the space above the liquid. The more highly carbonated the beverage, the higher the final pressure inside the bottle after re-sealing.
Remember, even with a real pressure seal, like the Metrokane sealer, your beverage will lose some "fizz" as carbon dioxide moves out of the beverage and into the space above the beverage ("head space"). The bigger the space above the bottle, the more fizz your beverage will lose ... even with a pressure seal!
Does anyone know of a way to eliminate "head space"?

While this product claims to be working for Champaign bottles, it's not always possible to use with wide necks. We couldn't apply it to Korbel sparkling wine unfortunately to our big disappointment. I must say that it works good for non-sparkling wine bottles, but this is not how this product is marketed - should be honestly mentioned "only works for non-sparkling or Champaign bottles.

Although this is a great champagne stopper, I bought it hoping to use it with trappist beers. Trappist beers are usually sold in 24oz bottles and they are champagne corked. If you don’t want to drink the whole bottle, it’s hard to keep the remainder from going flat. The bottle rims are not quite the same as champagne bottles so the traditional champagne stoppers just don’t work. Additionally, flip lever stoppers don’t expand wide enough to seal the bottle,
This thing actually does the trick. You simply turn the knob on top and the stopper continues to expand until it is tight inside the bottle opening. These are the best stoppers I have found since they expand to fit most any bottle opening.
I bought two but will probably pick up a couple more.

I’m a wine rep and this has saved me so many times. Corks will pop if you shove them in after opening. Cheap versions of sealers will last about 15 minutes. I’m traveling and neeeed this! An explosion of that bubbly will go places inside your car that never sees the light of day. As much as you clean, you will have spots and sticky surfaces for-ev-er UNLESS you have this sealer. So imagine the inside of your refrigerator.

An example where Amazon excels, in finding odd things immediately instead of driving to multiple stores around town!

I will go back to the beverage box house and buy a resealable champagne cap but I don't think I will buy this style again even though the original one I had worked for a long time.

This stopper is the best I've ever used! It seals the bottle up perfectly. I had a bottle of champagne in the refrigerator for almost a month and when I opened it back up, it was like I was opening a brand new bottle! I like to drink a mimosa now and then, but when it's only me, I don't drink the whole bottle. I've wasted too many bottles this way. Now with this stopper, I don't have to worry about always picking up a new bottle. Love it!

When it works, it’s very effective. However, at some point (that comes much too quickly), they stop working. The stopper won’t respond to the dial and that’s it. It no longer works. I won’t use them any longer and am looking for an alternative.

I've bought a few of these over the years. Gifted them to Family & Friends as well. They are awesome, WHILE THEY WORK !!! The Fizz in the champagne actually stays for 3-4 days ( sometimes more ) No problem in laying the bottle on its side verses standing it up.
BUT !!! they do spoil pretty fast if you twist it too much. You have to get the feel of it to see how far is just right. I dont now, have a problem with that, but I do have a problem with the whole topper getting very sticky. At first i thought it was just me, but My Son & Brother in PA, Sister in London England, Friend in Paris, France, Our vacation home in FL, Daughter & Her friend in NC, ALL have had the same problem. Soooo it has nothing to do with the atmosphere.
Having said that, these are way better than the others I've bought & experimented with. Thus I keep buying. I'm making my self feel better by thinking of them as expensive disposable toppers. But at least they last 2-4 years before they go bad.
Buying 4 more after I finish with this review.
Are they worth buying?? Yes.
Are they worth giving as a gift ? Yes.
More than it spoiling, I dont like it getting sticky. Maybe I need to keep it in its original case verses a drawer. Will try & up date review when the time comes.

So it worked great for about 5 times, then just stopped. No, I did not over tighten it. It was actually sealed properly, I unscrewed it, poured a glass and went to put it back on but it would no longer tighten/seal. It just spins. POS.
And I bought 2 of these too. Using the 2nd one right now but I'm sure that one is going to fail shortly too.

The stuff just comes back, sticky and icky as ever. So my theory is something is rotten on Denmark and it spread to this stopper.

I looked high and low to get a couple more of these. Bought some from QVC years ago and wanted a couple more. For the 2 liter soda bottle - these go on tight and seriously keep the fizz in your carbonated drinks. I LOVE them. If you want to save your carbonated beverages from going flat - these are the ticket.

rev_det.name: If you don't need a filter for sediment or precipitate, these are great. We have 4 that we bought previously for their other features, which are excellent. But, their "filter" is a joke. And, it was the need for filtering that prompted us to be this set. It was advertised as having a filter, in the past, when we bought these from various wine stores, no mention was made of a filtering capability. If you don't need to filter anything smaller than occasional cork chunks, these will be fine. But if you want actually filter out something smaller, buy something else.

We discovered these while out wine tasting in Napa. If the wineries are using these, you know they've got to be great. I've bought them twice now as friends keep asking me if they can have one after seeing it in use. The best part is their aeriation for red wine. As it pours out, it is aeriating the red wine and really taking it up a notch. And, there is a small screen inside right before the pour spout that will filter out any cork debris or bottom sediment which is an added bonus. A definite buy item! And great for gifting too!

I have used the product in the past and I am still very happy with my original set. They do every thing I need them to do - seal the bottle and not drip when I pour a glass of wine. The new set I received drip every time I used them. I wash them prior to use and rewashed them just to be sure they were not dirty and that may have been causing the dripping, Called the manufacturer and she instructed me to was them again because she was sure that was the problem. So I put them in the dishwasher and washed them again per her instructions- They still drip. She requested I send them back for inspection. Sorry can't do that the cost of shipping and return would out weigh the cost of the product so I am just retuning them to Amazon. You may have better luck and get a set that does not drip (my only problem with them) but if you don't the only way to get you money back for the defective product is through Amazon not the manufacturer. Thank you Amazon for standing up for what is sold on your site. .

I've used this in only one bottle of wine and was very easy to put in the bottle. It didn't leak, the top sealed tightly and it fit nicely in the door of the fridge. I really think the wine tasted better, too.
When it came time to take this off the empty bottle of wine, I had to wait for the bottle to get to room temperature to get it out. That's how tightly sealed it gets!
I will be getting these as gifts to all my wine lovers!

These are great. I use them for wine and champagne all the time - so much easier than trying to shove a cork back in, and a better seal than a wine stopper. I also use one on an old wine bottle for olive oil. My mom loved them so I bought some for her too. Just don’t forget to take them off before tossing an empty bottle!!

OK, call me a wino, but I like to be drinking a glass within 15 seconds of picking up a bottle. Using my opener and then popping in one of these corkers, I have a nice aerated and filtered glass in 15 seconds. Maybe I need to produce a video of this because some may not believe it. I bought a set of these for my next-door neighbor as well!

I do love this actual product, i got one as a present so i wanted more. However, these just came in a plastic baggie, not the actual wrapping to know if it is even the same one/ company, etc. Very disappointing because now i can't gift them as was my intent

Love this little tool! It's not very impressive looking (small, soft plastic material) but it's functionality is awesome. I bought the first in AZ at a wine specialty shop and spent the next couple years looking for more, which I did but at double the price. Since then, the best deal I've found is on Amazon for a set of 4. Even though there is no color selection for the set (black only), it's a great deal.
These are awesome little devices which aerate beautifully, provide a dripless pour, and provide a tight seal, allowing sideways storage. These are the best and I highly recommend.

As I enjoy wine, I have been given an abundance of wine accessories as gifts over the years. While it is indeed a pleasure to decant and serve wine in a carafe, I find this 5 in 1 Corker to be indispensable for every day use. Just open the bottle, stick in the Corker, and you have instant aeration, almost dripless pouring, sediment straining and the ability to seal the bottle for later. Easy to clean. This 4-pack was nice as I lost a couple of the caps when the attachment strap broke on my old Corkers (approx. 4 years old).

I'm in the wine business and I discovered these at Domaine Drouhin in Willamette Valley, Oregon recently and now they are all I want to use. The little spout keeps wine from dripping, the seal fits most bottles (even screw tops), the little top is attached so it can't get lost. The filter is porous enough so that the wine doesn't get too much air (if you want to decant a wine decant it, and most do not need decanting, especially new world wines).
Note these are BPA free, made out of medical grade silicon. If you don't want your wine to touch anything besides glass just pour (or drink:) it out of the bottle.

We’ve been fans of this trusted brand for year's. When we want to save our wine for later, we use Haley’s Corker. Love it! I hand wash ours in hot water and they last forever. I learned that they have a corporate program for gifts, which I’ll use in the future. Cheers! Thanks for great and speedy service!
These are similar to wine stoppers/pourers at a high end retail shop. So glad to find them online. Easy to push into bottle and pour. Helps save the wine for another day,

Love these and am on my third set. My dog keeps getting a hold of them which is the only reason I have to keep purchasing them. Great gift idea as well. Super easy to use and immediately replaces a cork when you open a bottle
I bought these because the stoppers would leak. These stoppers fit firmly in the bottle. The aerating is a bonus.

You can really purchase these anywhere. the wine company I typically order from sells these and for roughly the same price. If you Go to their website they have different colors as well! great gift idea too!

Bought the 4-pack, planning to use them with bottles of wine, oil and vinegar. They fit perfectly in the wine bottles and barely protrude above the bottle top, so they fit perfectly in my refrig. My one disappointment is that the Corker is too narrow for oil and vinegar bottles. The fit is so loose it practically falls out when the bottle it tipped, causing the oil or vinegar to spill.
It will fit all wine bottles and filter as it pours. I love these things. Bought for family and friends. Easy to clean. Love them.

These Corkers are the BEST EVER for your wine bottles. They have a no drip lip, a filter screen and an air flow for easy pouring. They seal nicely and last a long time. I just wish they made a 4 pack with 2 black and 2 red ones. The red are a bit hard to come by but I always use them for my red wine. And the low profile height when closed makes it easier to store the bottle back in the fridge.
These are so much better than I expected. If you are on the fence get off and buy them. I plan to buy them for all my friends and family.

I have tried tons of wine aerators and this is the best by far. I was in a winery in North Georgia they used these on alot of wine and spoke very highly of the product. Once I compared the wine with and without Haley's corker I was sold. Bought one that day, took it to a party, and the person that poured the last glass threw the bottle away with the corker on top. Theses are black so it is easy to do. They do sell colored ones but cold not get the same price. So I found them on here at the same price for 4 as what I paid for 1 at the winery.

rev_det.name:
I purchased these for a holiday party for ease of a 'festive' look with the red color
I liked the ease of use, however, I gave it only 4 stars based on a review I read about being able to lay bottle on side. We knew we'd have limited fridge space in the event we had any leftover wine. So based on the review that stated they were able to store on the bottle side, and nothing leaked, I purchased the product. It didn't work for us. We made sure to have the stopper securely in two bottles we needed to store in drawer of fridge. We were disappointed to find BOTH bottles of wine without the stopper in the bottles, creating a huge mess to clean up after. just beware of that potential hazard.

I bought 2 sets of these. I’m very surprised by the high rating. They fill up with water, the metal at the top keeps coming out. They get mold/bacteria growing in them because the metal doesn’t stay in. These are the worst.

I purchased these stoppers as the description stated that they were dishwasher safe. Although I washed them in the top rack of the dishwasher, the metal ornamental piece started to pop off after several weeks of use. It happened to all of the stoppers. Mold was growing inside the cavity between the silicone and the metal piece, so couldn't continue to use them.
I wish they were made of seamless single piece of silicone, and it would have worked. These stoppers are good looking and easy to use, so I was hoping they would work...too bad.

First world problems for sure, but I had had trouble finding a wine stopper/saver that allowed for the wine bottle to fit in the fridge when in use. Other wine stoppers were too tall. I don't have a fancy or special fridge, and even though the shelves are adjustable, I didn't want to adjust shelving (and lose height space on other shelves) for a wine bottle. These stoppers fit nice and low on the bottle, they are easier to put in and pull out, and they do a great job saving the wine. Two thumbs up!

Sadly, the stoppers I received have not worked properly. The first two I used leaked out just a bit, enough to drip out when the bottles are laying on their side in the wine fridge. The third one I used after I poured one glass of wine last night. Between the time I put the stopper in and placed the bottle and back in the wine fridge and the time I got home from work this evening, all except the wine that couldn't escape because it was laying on its side escaped the bottle to the bottom of the fridge and onto the floor. What a mess it made! I have used similar stoppers and never had the issues as I've had with these. Third time was a charm for me and I threw them all in the trash.

These were cheap and you get a little more than you pay for. They are not very strong, and I would not suggest expecting them to keep your wine from spilling. However, they do block the air and bugs from getting in your bottle. I would suggest use them at a party when you need to just keep it closed in between glasses, it will work fine. However, I wouldn't suggest it to keep for more than a day or so.

Unlike the cork stoppers that come with the bottle, these silicone stoppers will fit into the wine bottle time after time without any problems going in or removing them. Then can also be washed and reused hundreds of times. I thought they might be a bit small for the larger bottles of wine I purchase, but they are perfect just the way they are. They seal well and are so easy to remove and replace into the bottle I love them.

Easy to use. Great as a wine cork. Terrible that it keeps water trapped inside when you wash it, pretty soon you begin brewing your own vintage tap water inside of it that occasionally spits out when you shake it, quite disgusting.

This has a tighter fit than any other wine stopper I've tried -even the kind they sell at Bevmo and similar stores! It kept my sparkling wine carbonated for 3 days and regular wine tastes nearly as fresh as when first opened two days later. Absolutely recommend and I love that you get 5 for the price.

These work great for sealing a partially used wine bottle. My wife and I usually have a glass of wine in the evening and re-sealing the bottle with the original cork in a giant pain. These stoppers seal the bottle very well. Great price.

Made with real quality. I'm a wine drinker so this was exactly what I needed. Instead of recorking the bottle like I would usually do. It keeps the wine fresh allowing it to keep all of its flavors and body. Oh yeah the gold M for my name definitely is a nice touch . I recommend this product with no doubt. You'll definitely be happy as I am.
I love this wine topper! We have this as a gift, however, I so want want for myself!! So adorable and fun!!! It was a classy little Ornamental wine stopper that would look great on top of any bottle!
This was the second time I bought this item - birthday gifts for two wine lovers. Came on time, looked as promised & comes in its own box. Nice little item for the money.
Exactly what I was looking for for my wine topper bouquet. Sturdy and elegant looking.
Fun little personalized gift for a friend who enjoys wine.
Loved it!! But i found it to be a little on the expensive side!
The person I gave this gift to loved the gold color!
Purchased as gift for wine lover. Very nice and love being able to personalize wine stopper with initial.
Beautiful, as expected!

rev_det.name: We are using these for glass bottle soda pop, which goes flat so quickly. These are really easy to put on, seal well, and the contents stay fizzy for about 24 -36 hours. They seal pretty well, but I would not recommend shaking the bottle, or laying it on its side- there is pressure in that carbonation, and only so much friction in the seal.

We just purchased a new refrigerator. The shelf above where we wanted to store open wine bottles was so close to the one below that opened wine bottles with corks sticking out would not stand up straight. Bottles would tip over and sometimes fall out when the fridge door was opened. The upper shelf is not adjustable. Using these caps instead of tall wine corks saved the day. Great quality. Reasonable price. Would buy again.

You can lay the bottle on its side and not worry about it leaking. Very secure. Also, hardly adds any height to the bottle when standing in the fridge, this can be a problem if the stopper is too tall.
I needed a good fitting cap but one that was also easy to take off. Also wanted to store open wine bottles on their side in the fridge. These fit the bill perfectly.
Simple and effective product design. It was exactly what I needed.
Simple but useful. I love that they are flat so easily fit in my not so large fridge. I use them for wine, and any other bottles needed. When the cap of a sauce bottle broke, this worked as well.

This product caps a wine bottle perfectly. I like them because they are small profile but effective, They don’t take up a lot of room in my utility drawer and don’t rattle around. They are made of high-quality silicone that easily stretches over every bottle I’ve used so far. Well worth it!

I bought these specifically for the large sized champagne, because try as I might, I cannot always finish them :) This fit beautifully and when I pulled it off the other day, the bottle actually popped a little. They also fit the smaller size bottles too and for the price, you can't go wrong. I actually gave my sister a few and kept some for myself. A great gift and great to have if needed to save a bottle.
My wife loves this product. Caps are thin and do not add extra height to the bottle, and does a good job of sealing. I recommend.

I don’t drink wine but I do drink bottled Coca Cola and these do fit on top I was surprised you can tip the bottle upside down and it won’t spill, I bought them so when your drinking your drink and have to walk away you can pop this on top and there’s no worries, the only thing is you can’t keep it on for long because the carbon dioxide gas but this is a must buy.
We tried this on different bottles of beer and the carbonation forced the silicon cap off. We ended up wrapping a rubberband around the cap to secure it in place.

We use these on our regular glass bottles; beer, coolers, pop, etc., outside in the summer to keep the unwanted visitors out so there are no unpleasant surprises when you take a drink. They fit snug enough that they don't fall off, but easily pop off and back on when you want to take a drink.

These work great but they had a terrible odor when I first opened the package. I had to soak in warm soapy water for a few hours, I even rubbed lemon peel on them, then let them air out for a couple days before I could use them. If they didn't need to be cleaned and aired out I would have rated 5*

Sometimes you just need to put a lid on your beverage and call it a day, and these are perfect for that! They have worked on wine bottles, beer bottles, and liquor bottles. The beer was still carbonated the next day. I tested the covers for spillage and was thoroughly impressed. They wash well, don't leave a weird silicone taste on the bottle, and most importantly, they work!

Excellent capper, sold for wine bottles but works well on glass pop bottles too!
We like the old school Coca-Cola from Mexico, sold by various vendors around the USA. Saving the unused portions was a challenge until we purchased these caps.
Work like a charm!

Wow. I turned a bottle of wine (only around 6 oz left in it) upside down over the sink and it did not leak. I was impressed. I got 1 green 2 somewhat red, and 2 icky orange/brown caps. They work, but it would have been nice to get what was advertised - 5 different colors so we roomies could cap our wine with a different color to deep them straight. I guess for the price we can initial the top of the cap with a permanent Sharpie.
The colors of the real stoppers are dull and muddy. Nowhere near what the online pictures look like. I had bought them as a gift, but they looked too boring to give. I returned them.

I have a collection of clean, attractive vinegar bottles and have been looking for a cork or bottle cap to seal them. The torn metal top is unattractive and prickly. Now I feel confident in gifting salad dressings flavored oils and vinegars. I plan to buy more.

We're always looking for a cork for wine or beer and have tried several. These are super! Five is not too many-- put two in the camper, two in the kitchen, and give one to your son. Perfect! good design, easy to clean, easy on and easy off.

Purchased these to store open bottles of wine, and tried them on bottles that are different sizes. Was a little nervous laying the bottles on their sides in the fridge, but these worked perfectly! Not a single drop or leak, and we've been using these for over a week now. Highly recommend!

rev_det.name:
Bought a pack of 10 wine bottle stoppers and THEY ARE JUNK.
The first one I used was on a bottle of champagne and as I'm pressing the lever down to seal the bottle, the stopper exploded with parts flying right past my eye and landing all over the kitchen floor & counter, and the shaft with the silicone seal bobbing around inside the bottle.
The second one I tried seemed to work (as I shielded it with one hand while pressing the lever down with the other hand).
The third stopper I tried on a bottle of wine, and similar to the first stopper, it snapped/broke at the top with the small cross-bar/rod bending in half like a horseshoe, similar to the photo posted in another review.
In my experience so far, THESE ARE CHEAP PIECES OF CRAP, and I'll be looking for higher quality stoppers.
(FWIW: I bought 2 wine stoppers, in this same design/style, at a liquor store many years ago and they still work. I'm only looking at replacing them because the rubber stopper portion has become very discolored and somewhat hardened over time. But the overall quality of that pair of stoppers versus this set of 10 is like Night & Day).
I RECOMMEND LOOKING FOR HIGHER QUALITY STOPPERS.

I bought it because it looked good and value of the money. 1st one broke after a couple of uses on one bottle. I think the second one is going to break soon. Please look at the photo uploaded. The metal bar is bending.
The seller should let the manufacturer know and to improve the hardness of the small metal bar. Otherwise every body is not happy. Please do your best to make customers happy and their money worthy.

This may work well for wine bottles, but for some bottles where the bottle opening has a super short neck, like Bundaberg Ginger Beer, the rings on the 2 ring variety has the top ring too toward the middle to seal - you need to hold the stopper partly up off the bottle to get the ring to engage in the bottle neck. (the 1 ring variety has equally no chance). So getting these to work on bottles with short necks is problematic.
But for full neck bottles, you can insert the stopper fully, then close the lever and it seals.
Well we bought as stocken stuffers for the family. They seal really good. Seem to be of decent quality and kept the champagne bubbles flowing all of New Year's Eve. Nice group of functional stoppers.
These are the best wine stoppers that I have ever had. Sometimes I have to lay my wine bottles down in the refrigerator and they Never leak. Awesome.
Product is worth every penny, it is precisely made and does its job. rubber sealants works well.
I always have a couple of these with me for the impromptu glass or 2 of wine when with friends. Easy to use, keeps fresh for many days. Will buy more when I've given these all away again
These do not stay in the wine bottle. I have tried on several and they are too small to make a firm seal. In fact, they don't seal at all. Nothing seems to happen when the lever is pulled down.

My prior ones had a softer lever action, but the dishwasher melted them enough that they needed to be replaced.
This set was near the price I paid for 2 maybe 10 years ago, so they are a fantastic value
Most of them worked just fine. They are a little stiff. I have had similar ones in the past that were smoother to close

These are Absolutely the best bottle caps… Drink stay carbonated for a week at least… I wouldn’t use anything else.
Love these; easy to get in and out of the bottle.
Great! And dishwasher safe
These silicone corks fit any wine bottle tightly!
Good ones
